comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: I cannot find anything on Arthur Randolph. If this picture is related to Eleanor Randolph Wilson's wedding, presumably she was a relation? But I also can't find the origin of the middle name "Randolph". Eleanor's mother's maiden name was Axson.

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: A Mrs. Arthur Randolph (widow, the former Edith May) married William C. Whitney (widower) in 1896, at Bar Harbor. Whitney's grown son, Harry Payne Whitney, was by then newly married to Gertrude Vanderbilt (and Harry Payne Whitney has appeared recently in the Commons uploads, too). "In her youth she was a famous beauty, and she is still a tall, handsome, and graceful brunette," noted the New York Times about Edith May Randolph Whitney, when she married Whitney. Maybe this is an old photograph of her, revived in connection with a story in 1914? Edith May Randolph Whitney (1858-1899) was in a riding accident in 1898, and died in 1899 from the injuries sustained, at age 41. There's a picture of her and a story about the circumstances surrounding her brief marriage to Whitney here: www.newyorksocialdiary.com/node/750

comment._content: Whoever the lady was, that's one hell of great portrait. Seems to be a combination of focus and grained paper. Thank you, LOC.
